project/includes/litm.h

00001 /**
00002  * @file   litm.h
00003  *
00004  * @version $version
00005  *
00006  * @date   2009-04-24
00007  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00008  *
00009  * @mainpage Welcome to the documentation for the library LITM -- $version
00010  *
00011  *           The library serves as a <b>Lightweight Inter-Thread Messaging</b> under Linux/Unix.
00012  *
00013  * \section Dependencies
00014  *
00015  *                      <b>Mandatory</b>
00016  *
00017  *          - libpthread
00018  *
00019  *          <b>Optional</b>
00020  *          The following components are only required if building from source:
00021  *
00022  *          - scons
00023  *
00024  *          - python package "pyjld.os" (available through <i>easy_install</i>)
00025  *
00026  *
00027  * \section     Example_Usage Example Usage:
00028  *
00029  *                      \subsection Example_Opening Opening a connection
00030  *
00031  *                      \code
00032  *
00033  *                              litm_connection *conn;
00034  *                              litm_code code = litm_connection_open( &conn );
00035  *                              switch(code) {
00036  *                               case LITM_CODE_OK:
00037  *                                              // can start using the connection
00038  *                                              break;
00039  *                               case LITM_CODE_BUSY:
00040  *                                              // better try again later
00041  *                                              break;
00042  *                               default:
00043  *                                              //something is wrong...
00044  *                                              break;
00045  *                              }
00046  *                              // if everything is OK, create our worker thread
00047  *                              params->conn = conn; // pass along the LITM connection identifier
00048  *                              pthread_t thread;
00049  *                              pthread_create( &thread, NULL, &thread_fnction, (void *) &params );
00050  *
00051  *                      \endcode
00052  *
00053  *
00054  *                      \subsection Example_Subscribing Subscribing to a _bus_
00055  *
00056  *                              \code
00057  *                              // subscribing to bus #1
00058  *                              litm_code code = litm_subscribe(conn, 1);
00059  *                                ... check return code ...
00060  *
00061  *                              \endcode
00062  *
00063  *
00064  *                      \subsection Example_Sending Sending a message on a _bus_
00065  *
00066  *                              \code
00067  *                              // litm connection should be passed through the thread params
00068  *                              void *thread_function(void *params) {
00069  *
00070  *                                      void *message; // whatever structure
00071  *                                      litm_code code = litm_send(conn, bus_id, message, NULL);
00072  *                                       ... check return code ...
00073  *
00074  *                                      ...
00075  *
00076  *                              }//thread_function
00077  *                              \endcode
00078  *
00079  *
00080  *                      \subsection Example_Receiving Receiving a message
00081  *
00082  *                              \code
00083  *                                      ... inside the thread_function ...
00084  *
00085  *                                      litm_envelope *envelope;
00086  *                                      litm_code code = litm_receive_nb(conn, &envelope);
00087  *                                       ... check return code ...
00088  *
00089  *                                      void *msg;
00090  *                                      msg = litm_get_message( envelope );
00091  *
00092  *                                       ... process message WITHOUT MODIFYING IT ...
00093  *
00094  *                                      // return the envelope to LITM
00095  *                                      code = litm_release(conn, envelope);
00096  *
00097  *                              \endcode
00098  *
00099  * \todo Better shutdown system
00100  * \todo Better connection close
00101  *
00102  */
00103 
00104 #ifndef LITM_H_
00105 #define LITM_H_
00106 
00107 #       include <sys/types.h>
00108 #       include <pthread.h>
00109 
00110 
00111 #       define LITM_CONNECTION_MAX 15
00112 #       define LITM_BUSSES_MAX     7
00113 
00114                 /**
00115                  * Queue node - entry in a queue
00116                  *
00117                  * @param msg:  pointer to the message
00118                  * @param next: pointer to the ``next`` queue_node entry
00119                  */
00120                 typedef struct _queue_node {
00121                         void *node;
00122                         struct _queue_node *next;
00123                 } queue_node;
00124 
00125                 /**
00126                  * Queue - thread-safe
00127                  *
00128                  * @param mutex: mutex
00129                  * @param head:  pointer to ``head``
00130                  * @param tail:  pointer to ``tail``
00131                  */
00132                 typedef struct {
00133                         pthread_mutex_t *mutex;
00134                         struct _queue_node *head, *tail;
00135                 } queue;
00136 
00137 
00138                 /**
00139                  * ``Bus`` identifier type
00140                  */
00141                 typedef int litm_bus;
00142 
00143                 /**
00144                  * ``Connection Status`` type
00145                  */
00146                 typedef enum _litm_connection_status_codes {
00147                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_INVALID = 0,
00148                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_ACTIVE,
00149                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_PENDING_DELETION
00150                 } litm_connection_status;
00151 
00152                 /**
00153                  * ``Connection`` type
00154                  *
00155                  * @param input_queue the connection's input queue
00156                  */
00157                 typedef struct _litm_connection {
00158                         litm_connection_status status;
00159                         queue *input_queue;
00160                 } litm_connection;
00161 
00162                 //typedef _litm_connection litm_connection;
00163 
00164                 /**
00165                  * Envelope Routing
00166                  *
00167                  * @param pending Pending Status Flag
00168                  * @param bus_id  Destination ``bus``
00169                  * @param sender  The sender's connection pointer
00170                  * @param current The current recipient's connection pointer
00171                  */
00172                 typedef struct {
00173                         int                              pending;
00174                         litm_bus         bus_id;
00175                         litm_connection *sender;
00176                         litm_connection *current;
00177                 } __litm_routing;
00178 
00179 
00180 
00181 
00182                 // Return Codes
00183                 // ------------
00184                 //
00185                 typedef enum _litm_codes {
00186                         LITM_CODE_OK = 0,
00187                         LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE,
00188                         LITM_CODE_BUSY,
00189                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC,
00190                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_OPEN,
00191                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION,
00192                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_MORE_CONNECTIONS,
00193                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS,
00194                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT,
00195                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT,
00196                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND,
00197                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING,                                 //can't send to the recipient
00198                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE,
00199                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE,
00200                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND,
00201                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL,
00202                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS,
00203                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE
00204 
00205                 } litm_code;
00206 
00207 
00208                 /**
00209                  * ``Envelope`` structure for messages
00210                  *
00211                  * @param cleaner The ``cleaner`` function to use
00212                  * @param routes  The ``routing`` structure
00213                  * @param msg     The pointer to the message
00214                  *
00215                  * Contains the pointer to the message
00216                  *  as well as a ``routing`` structure
00217                  *  used to deliver the said message
00218                  *  to all bus which have at least
00219                  *  1 subscriber.
00220                  *
00221                  * The client (ie. receiver of the envelope)
00222                  *  must not tamper with the message (ie. msg)
00223                  *  as it is shared with other client(s).
00224                  *
00225                  */
00226                 typedef struct _litm_envelope {
00227 
00228                         int released_count;
00229                         int delivery_count;
00230                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg);
00231                         __litm_routing routes;
00232                         void *msg;
00233 
00234                 } litm_envelope;
00235 
00236 
00237                 /**
00238                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00239                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference
00240                  *
00241                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00242                  */
00243                 litm_code litm_connect(litm_connection **conn);
00244 
00245 
00246                 /**
00247                  * Disconnects from the ``switch``
00248                  *
00249                  * Once a client calls this function, no more access
00250                  * with the connection is permitted to any of the
00251                  * following functions:
00252                  *
00253                  *  - litm_subscribe
00254                  *  - litm_unsubscribe
00255                  *  - litm_receive_nb
00256                  *  - litm_send
00257                  *  - litm_release
00258                  *
00259                  * Be sure to release any message in the client's
00260                  * care before disconnecting.
00261                  *
00262                  * @param *conn connection reference
00263                  */
00264                 litm_code litm_disconnect(litm_connection *conn);
00265 
00266 
00267                 /**
00268                  * Subscribe to a ``bus``
00269                  *
00270                  * @see litm_disconnect
00271                  *
00272                  * @param *conn connection reference
00273                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to subscribe to
00274                  *
00275                  */
00276                 litm_code litm_subscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00277 
00278 
00279                 /**
00280                  * Unsubscribe from a ``bus``
00281                  *
00282                  * @see litm_disconnect
00283                  *
00284                  * @param *conn connection reference
00285                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to unsubscribe from
00286                  */
00287                 litm_code litm_unsubscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00288 
00289 
00290                 /**
00291                  * Send message on a ``bus``
00292                  *
00293                  * @see litm_disconnect
00294                  *
00295                  * @param *conn connection reference
00296                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
00297                  * @param *msg the pointer to the message
00298                  * @param *cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
00299                  *
00300                  * If omitted, the default ``cleaner`` function will be
00301                  * <b>free()</b>.
00302                  *
00303                  * If an error occurs, it is the responsibility of the sender
00304                  *  to dispose of the ``messages`` appropriately.  If the
00305                  *  operation went LITM_CODE_OK, then once all recipients
00306                  *  are finished with the message, the ``cleaner`` will be
00307                  *  called with the message pointer OR if ``cleaner`` is
00308                  *  NULL, the message will simply be freed with free().
00309                  *
00310                  */
00311                 litm_code litm_send(    litm_connection *conn,
00312                                                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00313                                                                 void *msg,
00314                                                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg)
00315                                                                 );
00316 
00317 
00318                 /**
00319                  * Receives (non-blocking) from any ``bus``
00320                  *
00321                  * @see litm_disconnect
00322                  *
00323                  * @param *conn connection reference
00324                  * @param **envlp the pointer to received envelope
00325                  *
00326                  */
00327                 litm_code litm_receive_nb(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp);
00328 
00329 
00330                 /**
00331                  * Releases an ``envelope``
00332                  *
00333                  * @see litm_disconnect
00334                  *
00335                  * @param *conn connection reference
00336                  * @param *envlp the pointer to received envelope to release
00337                  *
00338                  *  Once the client has consumed the message
00339                  *  ``contained`` in the envelope, the client
00340                  *  **MUST** release it back to litm.
00341                  */
00342                 litm_code litm_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp);
00343 
00344 
00345                 /**
00346                  * Shutdown
00347                  *
00348                  * This function attempts to shutdown all the connection
00349                  * threads in a graceful manner.  This function is blocking.
00350                  */
00351                 void litm_shutdown(void);
00352 
00353 
00354                 /**
00355                  * Returns a copy of the pointer to the message.
00356                  *
00357                  * @param *envlp the envelope from which to extract the pointer to the message
00358                  *
00359                  * This function should be used instead
00360                  *  of relying on the ``litm_envelope``
00361                  *  data structure.
00362                  *
00363                  *  <b>** DO NOT** modify the message!</b>
00364                  *
00365                  */
00366                 void *litm_get_message(litm_envelope *envlp);
00367 
00368 
00369                 /**
00370                  * Translates a code to a message pointer
00371                  *
00372                  * @param code a <i>litm_code</i> to translate to a string version
00373                  *
00374                  */
00375                 char *litm_translate_code(litm_code code);
00376 
00377 
00378 #endif /* LITM_H_ */
